intro: Protium divaricatum subsp. fumarium, commonly known as the fumarium protium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Sapotaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in clusters. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in lowland tropical forests. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its dispersal in the natural habitat.
